key.stat.category.core.tooltip.name: Core Stats
key.stat.category.core.tooltip.descripti:
Your [key.stat.category.core](Core) stats are sort of like the 'building blocks' of your character.
They represent your fundamental strength, with many weapons, skills and spells scaling off of these stats.
Your [key.stat.category.core](Core) stats are responsible for many of your other sub-stats as well.
For instance, [key.stat.constitution] is what determines your [key.stat.health.max] and your [key.stat.stamina.max].
key.stat.category.health.tooltip.name: Health
key.stat.category.health.tooltip.descrip:
Your [key.stat.health] is reduced by any [key.mechanic.damage] you take.
When your [key.stat.health] reaches zero, you [key.mechanic.death](Die).
Try to avoid that!
key.stat.category.stamina.tooltip.name: Stamina
[key.stat.concentration] is used to maintain spells that require a greater degree of mental focus.
Some spells will lower your [key.stat.concentration.max] while they are active and others will actively drain your [key.stat.concentration] while you maintain them.
key.stat.category.posture.tooltip.name: Posture
key.stat.category.posture.tooltip.descri:
Your [key.stat.posture] represents how stable you are while [key.mechanic.block](Blocking).
As long as your [key.stat.posture] doesn't [key.mechanic.posture_break](Break), you will take no damage while [key.mechanic.block](Blocking).
Weapons all have their own [key.mechanic.block_guard] values, which determines how much of the damage blocked is converted into [key.mechanic.posture_damage].
key.stat.category.magic.tooltip.name: Magic
key.stat.category.magic.tooltip.descript:
Magic represents your apptitude at casting spells.
Spells are cast using [key.stat.magic.mana].
[key.flavour.negative](Spellcasting is not yet implemented. Sorry!)
key.stat.category.attack.tooltip.name: Attack
key.stat.category.attack.tooltip.descrip:
Represents your apptitude at attacking with [key.flag.physical] attacks.
[key.flag.physical] attacks are typically made with [key.flag.melee] weapons and [key.flag.magic](non-Magical) [key.flag.ranged] weapons such as [key.item_tag.bow](Bows).
key.stat.category.movement.tooltip.name: Movement
key.stat.category.power.tooltip.name: Power
key.stat.category.power.tooltip.descript:
Your [key.stat.category.power] stats represent how strong the effects you create will be.
How much [key.stat.category.power] influences the strength of these effects is determined by the effect itself.
For instance, spells that are more specialized will have stronger, more focused scalings in fewer categories.
As an example, [key.flag.fire] spells may have a higher [key.stat.power.fire] scaling than it does [key.stat.magic.power] - meaning that each point of [key.stat.power.fire] you have matters more than each point of [key.stat.magic.power].
key.stat.category.penetration.tooltip.de:
Your [key.stat.category.penetration] stats are used to reduce your targets [key.stat.category.defense](Defensive) stats before your any [key.mechanic.damage] you deal is applied.
[key.stat.category.penetration] is a dual stat, it has a flat value and a percentage value [key.flavour.reminder]((you can swap between them by hodling CTRL.))
[key.stat.category.penetration] first reduces the targets [key.stat.category.defense] by the [key.stat.category.penetration] stats percentage value, and then reduce the targets [key.stat.category.defense] by the [key.stat.category.penetration](Penetrations) flat value.
This final [key.stat.category.defense] value is now used for the rest of the [key.mechanic.damage] calculation.
[key.stat.category.penetration] can bring a targets [key.stat.category.defense] below zero.
key.stat.category.defense.tooltip.name: Defense
key.stat.category.misc.tooltip.name: Misc
key.stat.grit.tooltip.name: Grit
key.stat.grit.tooltip.description:
[key.stat.grit] is a buffer of temporary [key.stat.health] that will be reduced before your [key.stat.health] in the event that you take [key.stat.damage].
[key.stat.grit] decays naturally over time and can stack up to your [key.stat.health.max].
key.stat.magic.mana.tooltip.name: Mana
key.stat.magic.mana.tooltip.description:
[key.stat.magic.mana] is used to cast spells, with higher level spells costing more mana.
It does not regenerate naturally.
Most spellcasting classes will start each run with a [key.item_tag.flask] that will restore [key.stat.mana].
key.mechanic.parry_window.tooltip.name: Parry Window
key.mechanic.parry_window.tooltip.descri: Your [key.mechanic.parry_window] is how long in seconds after you start [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) that any attack [key.mechanic.block](Blocked) will instead be [key.mechanic.parry](Parried).
key.mechanic.block_guard.tooltip.name: Guard
key.mechanic.block_guard.tooltip.descrip:
[key.mechanic.block_guard](Guard) is the property of [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) implements that determines how much of the blocked damage is converted into [key.mechanic.posture_damage].
Higher [key.mechanic.block_guard] values will result in less [key.stat.posture] being lost during your blocks, allowing you to block more damaging attacks safely.
key.mechanic.execute.tooltip.name: Execute
key.mechanic.execute.tooltip.description:
When you strike a [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned) enemy on its [key.mechanic.weak_point] your strike will become a [key.mechanic.critical_hit] and you will perform an [key.mechanic.execute](Execution).
[key.mechanic.execute](Executions) deal [key.const.execution_mult] more damage by default, but many other effects will [key.mechanic.trigger] off them as well.
key.mechanic.trigger.tooltip.name: Triggers
key.mechanic.trigger.tooltip.description:
Some effects will "[key.mechanic.trigger]" other effects.
For instance [key.trigger.on_parry] triggers are triggered when you successfully [key.mechanic.parry] an attack. When an effect is triggered it may produce new results or augment whatever action initiated the trigger in some way.
key.mechanic.parry.tooltip.name: Parrying
key.mechanic.parry.tooltip.description:
[key.mechanic.parry](Parries) will completely negate the damage of an attack and also prevent any [key.mechanic.posture_damage] you would've received.
You can [key.mechanic.parry] most attacks by [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) just before the attack lands.
You must start the [key.mechanic.block] within the [key.mechanic.parry_window] of the implement you're [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) with (0.25 seconds by default).
Some effects will be able to upgrade your [key.mechanic.block](Blocks) into [key.mechanic.parry](Parries) or otherwise manipulate your [key.mechanic.parry_window].
key.mechanic.block.tooltip.name: Blocking
key.mechanic.block.tooltip.description:
You can [key.mechanic.block] by holding an object capable of blocking (most weapons will work) in one of your hands and pressing your [key.input.block] key.
If you raise your [key.mechanic.block] within the [key.mechanic.parry_window] of the implement you're [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) with (0.25 seconds by default), you will instead [key.mechanic.parry] the attack.
When you [key.mechanic.block] an attack you will take [key.mechanic.posture_damage] based on the damage dealt by the attack and the [key.mechanic.block_guard] values on your blocking implement.
Higher [key.mechanic.block_guard] values will result in less [key.stat.posture] damage being received.
As long as your [key.stat.posture] stays above zero, you will take no damage from the blocked attack. You may still receive some other effects from the blocket attack however.
If your [key.stat.posture] reaches zero you will be [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken) and any excess damage will carry through as normal.
When [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken) you will be unable to block until your [key.stat.posture] fully recharges, however, you can still [key.mechanic.parry] even when [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken).
key.mechanic.posture_damage.tooltip.name: Posture Damage (Player)
key.mechanic.posture_damage.tooltip.desc:
[key.mechanic.posture_damage] is received (usually) when you [key.mechanic.block] an attack without [key.mechanic.parry](Parrying) it.
Some effects will be able to damage your [key.stat.posture] without being able to [key.mechanic.posture_break](Break) it.
 Taking [key.mechanic.posture_damage] does not carry any immediate downsides, but can be dangerous if you run out of [key.stat.posture].
If you [key.mechanic.block] an attack that takes your [key.stat.posture] to zero you will become [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken), preventing you from [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) until your [key.stat.posture] regenerates completely.
To read about how enemies are affected by this [key.mechanic.posture_damage_enemy](click here).
key.mechanic.posture_break.tooltip.name: Posture Break (Player)
key.mechanic.posture_break.tooltip.descr:
When an effect capable of breaking your [key.stat.posture] reduces it to zero you will become [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken).
The most common cause of this is [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) an attack without enough [key.stat.posture] to prevent all the damage.
Some effects can damage your [key.stat.posture] without [key.mechanic.posture_break](Breaking) it.
When [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken) your [key.mechanic.block](Blocks) [key.flavour.negative](will not prevent any damage) and you must wait until your [key.stat.posture] completely recharges before you will be able to [key.mechanic.block] again.
You are still able to [key.mechanic.parry] attacks even while [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken).
To read about what happens to enemies when they are [key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy](Posture Broken, click here).
key.mechanic.posture_damage_enemy.toolti:
When you deal [key.mechanic.posture_damage_enemy] to an enemy (usually by hitting them with a weapon) you will reduce their [key.mechanic.stability].
When an enemy hits zero [key.mechanic.stability] they become [key.mechanic.staggered].
If an enemy hits zero [key.stat.posture] they will instead be [key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy](Posture Broken) and become [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned).
To read about how you are affected by [key.mechanic.posture_damage](Posture Damage, click here).
key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy.tooltip:
When you [key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy] most enemies they will become [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned).
While an enemy is [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned) you can strike their [key.mechanic.weak_point] in order to perform an [key.mechanic.execute](Execution).
To read about how you are affected by [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Breaks, click here).
key.mechanic.staggered.tooltip.name: Staggered
key.mechanic.stability.tooltip.name: Stability
key.mechanic.stun.tooltip.name: Stuns
key.mechanic.stun.tooltip.description:
When you [key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy] an enemy they will usually becomed [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned).
While [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned) you may attack an enemies [key.mechanic.weak_point] in order to perform an [key.mechanic.execute](Execution).
An enemy being [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned) is a good opportunity to use your [key.item_tag.flask] or let your [key.stat.stamina] regenerate.
key.mechanic.critical_hit.tooltip.name: Critical Hits
key.mechanic.critical_hit.tooltip.descri:
When you score a [key.mechanic.critical_hit] (usually by hitting an enemies [key.mechanic.weak_point]) you will increase the damage of your attack using your [key.stat.physical.critical_multiplier].
[key.mechanic.critical_hit](Critical Hits) are an effective way to greatly amplify your damage.
key.mechanic.weak_point.tooltip.name: Weak Points
key.mechanic.weak_point.tooltip.descript:
Most enemies will have a [key.mechanic.weak_point] somewhere on their body.
It wont always be obvious!
But for the most part you can ituit where its (e.g. the head).
Attacking an enemies [key.mechanic.weak_point] with most weapons (and some spells) will score a [key.mechanic.critical_hit].
key.mechanic.damage.tooltip.name: Damage
key.mechanic.damage.tooltip.description:
[key.mechanic.damage] is how you reduce an enemies [key.stat.health] to zero.
[key.mechanic.damage] can have its own damage type (e.g. [key.flag.fire] or [key.flag.poison]) and can be flagged as [key.flag.magic](Magical) or [key.flag.physical](Physical).
key.mechanic.dual_wielding.tooltip.name: Dual-Wielding
key.mechanic.dual_wielding.tooltip.descr:
You are considered to be [key.mechanic.dual_wielding] when you are holding a weapon in either hand with the exception of [key.item_tag.shield](Shields).
Some [key.hold_type.two_handed] weapons may also count as [key.mechanic.dual_wielding] when it suits.
key.status.bleed.tooltip.name: Bleed
key.status.bleed.tooltip.description: i dunno i haven't really thought about it
key.status.slow.tooltip.name: Slow
key.status.slow.tooltip.description: Reduces the targets [key.stat.attack.speed] and [key.stat.movement.speed] for the duration.
key.trigger.on_parry.tooltip.name: On Parry (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_block.tooltip.name: On Block (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_execute.tooltip.name: On Execute (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_stun.tooltip.name: On Stun (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_stun.tooltip.description: [key.mechanic.trigger](Triggers) whenever you [key.mechanic.stun] an enemy, typically by [key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy](Posture Breaking) them.
key.trigger.on_death.tooltip.name: On Death (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_death.tooltip.description:
[key.mechanic.trigger](Triggers) whenever you would [key.mechanic.death](Die).
Some effects may prevent your [key.mechanic.death] or otherwise change how it plays out.
key.trigger.on_kill.tooltip.name: On Kill (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_kill.tooltip.description:
[key.mechanic.trigger](Triggers) whenever you [key.mechanic.kill] an enemy.
Some effects will also require you to [key.mechanic.kill] the enemy in specific ways.
key.trigger.on_activate.tooltip.name: On Activation
key.item_tag.shield.tooltip.name: Shields
key.item_tag.shield.tooltip.description:
[key.item_tag.shield](Shields) are simply a different category of weapon - they function the same as any other.
However, shields often have higher [key.mechanic.block_guard] values and usually grant some extra [key.stat.posture].
key.item_tag.sword.tooltip.name: Swords
key.item_tag.sword.tooltip.description: Swords are a broad category of weapons that can include [key.hold_type.one_handed] weapons or [key.hold_type.two_handed] weapons.
key.item_tag.dagger.tooltip.name: Daggers
key.item_tag.dagger.tooltip.description:
Daggers are lil pointy sticks that you can stab people with.
They typically scale more with [key.stat.dexterity] than most weapons and are always [key.hold_type.one_handed].
key.item_tag.light.tooltip.name: Light
key.item_tag.light.tooltip.description: [key.item_tag.light] items weigh less than other items in their category, but the [key.item_tag.light] tag doesn't anything special on their own, but some features may check for this tag.
key.item_tag.heavy.tooltip.name: Heavy
key.item_tag.heavy.tooltip.description: [key.item_tag.heavy] items weigh more than other items in their category, but the [key.item_tag.heavy] tag doesn't anything special on their own, but some features may check for this tag.
key.item_tag.armor.tooltip.name: Armor
key.item_tag.armor.tooltip.description: [key.item_tag.armor] is any equipment that goes into your head, chest, arm and leg slots.
key.item_tag.bow.tooltip.name: Bow
key.item_tag.bow.tooltip.description:
[key.item_tag.bow](Bows) typically fire arrows at stuff.
Sometimes they have wacky effects.
key.item_tag.arrow.tooltip.name: Arrow
key.item_tag.arrow.tooltip.description:
[key.flag.physical] projectile typically fired by a [key.item_tag.bow].
Arrows will inherit the flags of whatever weapon fires them.
key.item_tag.flask.tooltip.name: Flask
key.item_tag.flask.tooltip.description:
You start each run with a [key.item_tag.flask] and a number of [key.stat.flask_charges] (usually 2).
You can drink from your [key.item_tag.flask] by pressing your [key.input.flask] key.
Each classes starting [key.item_tag.flask] is unique though they will almost always restore some [key.stat.health] or [key.stat.mana] (or sometimes both).
You can find more unique [key.item_tag.flask](Flasks) in the dungeon.
key.flag.melee.tooltip.name: Melee
key.flag.melee.tooltip.description:
Smacking an enemy with a stick is a [key.flag.melee] attack. So is punching them in the face.
Very occasionally, some [key.flag.ranged] or [key.flag.spell] options may count as a [key.flag.melee] attack for the purpose of [key.mechanic.trigger](Triggering) extra effects.
key.flag.ranged.tooltip.name: Ranged
key.flag.ranged.tooltip.description:
Shooting an enemy with an arrow is an example of a [key.flag.ranged] attack.
Some [key.flag.spell](Spell) attacks may also be flagged as [key.flag.ranged]. [key.flag.spell](Spells) will have tags to show what flags they have.
key.flag.physical.tooltip.name: Physical
key.flag.physical.tooltip.description:
Attacks are usually flagged as [key.flag.physical] when you're hitting something with a physical object, such as a [key.item_tag.sword] or [key.item_tag.arrow].
Some [key.flag.spell](Spells) may count as physical if, say, they throw a physics object or boulder made of earth.
key.flag.magic.tooltip.name: Magic (Flag)
key.flag.magic.tooltip.description:
Attacks flagged as [key.flag.magic](Magical) usually come from [key.flag.spell](Spells) or sometimes [key.flag.enchanted] weapons.
However it got the flag, [key.flag.magic] attacks are usually harder to defend against.
key.flag.enchanted.tooltip.name: Enchanted (Flag)
key.flag.enchanted.tooltip.description:
[key.flag.enchanted] items are imbued with special properties beyond what they would ordinarily have.
These effects are so broad that trying to describe them here is silly - go find them!
key.flag.spell.tooltip.name: Magic
key.flag.healing.tooltip.name: Healing (Flag)
key.flag.healing.tooltip.description:
[key.flag.healing] effcts include anything that restores [key.stat.health].
[key.flag.healing] effects can be flagged as both [key.flag.magic](Magical) and [key.flag.physical](Physical).
key.flag.arcane.tooltip.name: Arcane
key.flag.divine.tooltip.name: Divine
key.flag.occult.tooltip.name: Occult
key.flag.fire.tooltip.name: Fire
key.flag.frost.tooltip.name: Frost
key.flag.electric.tooltip.name: Electric
key.flag.poison.tooltip.name: Poison
key.flag.necrotic.tooltip.name: Necrotic
key.flavour.important: You shouldn't see this! Yell at fortune :)
key.flavour.positive: You shouldn't see this! Yell at fortune :)
key.flavour.negative: You shouldn't see this! Yell at fortune :)
key.flavour.reminder: You shouldn't see this! Yell at fortune :)
key.variable.positive: You shouldn't see me!! Yell at fortune :)
key.variable.negative: You shouldn't see me!! Yell at fortune :)
